meanings.definition: To suppose or assume beforehand; take for granted
meanings.sent1: I presuppose that the sun will rise tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: Scientists presuppose certain facts before conducting experiments.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how he presupposed that his cat could talk.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to move presupposed a new beginning in her life.
meanings.sent5: Let's presuppose that everything will work out in the end.

meanings.definition: To require or imply as an antecedent condition
meanings.sent1: The job offer presupposes a background check.
meanings.sent2: The contract presupposes timely delivery of the goods.
meanings.sent3: The recipe presupposed that you had all the ingredients, but you didn't.
meanings.sent4: His apology presupposed an admission of guilt.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project presupposes teamwork and dedication.
